name: chickpea soup
ingredients: 1 jar of chickpeas (or 400 g of cooked canned chickpeas)
2 pieces of celery (washed and finely sliced)
6 dl vegetable broth Spar (or 300 ml water + broth)
400 g canned peeled tomatoes with garlic (or 400 g diced tomatoes with their juice)
Handful of cilantro or flat-leaf parsley (chopped)
Juice and zest of 1/2 lemon (or just the juice)
Salt and freshly ground black pepper (to taste)
steps: Wash the celery and slice it finely. Peel the onion and slice it finely.
Rinse the chickpeas under cold water and drain them.
Heat the olive oil in a large pot. Saut√© the onion and celery over low heat without letting them brown. (About 5-8 minutes).
Sprinkle with ground cumin (and garlic powder and curry if used) and let simmer a bit longer.
Increase the heat and add the vegetable broth (or water), tomatoes (diced or peeled), and chickpeas.
Season with freshly ground black pepper (and salt). Continue cooking for 8 minutes (or let simmer for 30 minutes if no green beans are added).
Add the green beans (if used) and the lemon juice. Let simmer for another 2 minutes.
Garnish the soup with fresh chopped herbs and lemon zest (if used). Serve hot.
